text:
I used apache 2, mod_jk 1.2, and tomcat 5. When I undeploy an application on 
tomcat, and then I access that application using through apache and jk, jk will 
send a 503 error to apache. What I want to do is to customize this error page 
in apache, and it failed.

I know I could achieve by customizing under tomcat, but since the tomcat is 
running critical services, and i want all static pages (including error pages) 
handled by apache.

any advice is really appreciated, including telling this is not feasible.

thanks a lot

text:
I'm wondering where's here the bug. Configuration related question should be
addressed to users@httpd or something similar.

Try ErrorDocument directive in your apache httpd instance.
It works for me:
ErrorDocument /503.htm 
503.htm contains meta refresh with value of 5 sec.
